entry.title: Clean Core SAP TM â€“ Part 1: Avoiding View-Exit Enhancements in the Transportation Cockpit
entry.content:
The Transportation Cockpit is one of the most widely used applications within SAP Transportation Management (TM). Because of its intuitive planning UI, business users often request additional information or custom filters. Traditionally, many customers have met these requirements by implementing view-exit enhancements in Web Dynpro Floorplan Manager (FPM) classes, such as /SCMTMS/CL_UI_VIEWEXIT_PLN_NEW.

However, these implicit enhancements often lead to:

  • Performance issues
  • Increased maintenance effort
  • Upgrade complications
  • Deviation from clean core principles

In this blog, we look at how these enhancements can be avoided using standard SAP TM capabilities â€” while still meeting business needs.

Why Do Enhancements Commonly Occur?

Enhancements are generally introduced for two purposes:

  1. Displaying additional fields in the Transportation Cockpit
  2. Applying filters based on custom fields

Instead of enhancing the UI layer, SAP TM provides standard mechanisms to achieve both requirements cleanly.

1ï¸âƒ£Avoid View-Exit Enhancements for Displaying Additional Fields, instead use Field Catalog

If you extend one of the following TOR business object nodes:

  • ROOT
  • STOP
  • STOP_SUCCESSOR
  • ITEM_TR

â€¦using the standard extension include, then the added fields are automatically available in the associated field catalogs. You can then:

  • Adjust labels
  • Set display behavior
  • Enable default visibility

This eliminates the need for view exit coding.

SAP has also significantly expanded the delivered UI structures over time. For example, fields such as Original Order, Order Category, Original Delivery, and Delivery Category are now included by default, removing the need for older enhancement approaches.

Benefits

Benefit

Description

âœ…Clean Core

Avoids custom coding and simplifies upgrades

âœ…Reduced TCO

Less maintenance effort and fewer regression risks

âœ…Better Performance

Fields are retrieved efficiently in the persistence layer

You may refer my colleague @Aleksey_Belskii 's blog on detailed steps for the usage of field catalog.

2ï¸âƒ£Avoid UI Filtering Enhancements â€” Use Selection Profile Extensions

Custom filtering is often done by either:

  • Asking planners to manually filter in the UI
  • Implementing filtering logic inside view-exits

Both approaches have drawbacks:

  • UI filters load unnecessary data first â†’ performance impact
  • View-exits â†’ non-clean-core solution

The Standard Solution

SAP TM supports custom fields in Additional Selection Criteria of Selection Profiles â€” allowing filtering at the query level, not the UI layer.

See SAP Note : 3611306 - Improved enhancement capability in additional selection attributes

Example Scenario

You have added a custom field ZZ_GRP_IND to the ROOT node of the TOR object using enhancement include /SCMTMS/INCL_EEW_TOR_ROOT.  Now you need to enable this field for additional selection criteria- lets do it in two steps.

Step 1 â€“ Append the Custom Field to the Selection Structure

Append structure /SCMTMS/S_TOR_Q_FU_STG_PLN with ZZ_GRP_IND. For FO, use /SCMTMS/S_TOR_Q.

â†’ The field now appears in the Additional Selection Criteria search help.

Step 2 â€“ Map the Field via Query Enhancement

Use transaction: /SCMTMS/QUERY_ENH

Configure query:

  • Query Name: FU_STAGE_DATA_BY_ATTR
  • Map UI attribute ZZ_GRP_IND â†’ BO node attribute ROOT-ZZ_GRP_IND

â†’ The system will now include the custom field in selection queries automatically.

Result

  • No UI-layer filtering
  • No custom code
  • Fully upgrade-safe

ğŸ¯Conclusion

By leveraging:

  • Field Catalogs, and
  • Selection Profile Query Enhancements

â€¦you can eliminate many commonly seen UI-level enhancements in SAP TM. This approach supports:

  • Clean core architecture
  • Reduced cost of ownership
  • Better system performance
  • Upgrade readiness

This blog is the first in a Clean Core SAP TM series.

More scenarios and practical examples will follow â€” stay tuned!

entry.title: Looking for Interview Partners for my Master's Thesis about Migrating to SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

For my master's thesis at IU International University of Applied Sciences, I am looking for SAP experts who would like to share their experiences with the migration to SAP S/4HANA.

What is it about? I want to find out which challenges occur during the migration to SAP S/4HANA and how these can be overcome. The goal is to create a practical guide that supports companies in a successful migration. The focus is on the metal and electrical industry.

Participation Requirements:

  • Practical experience with the migration to SAP S/4HANA in the metal and electrical industry
  • It doesn't matter what role you had in the project

The interview will take place online, can be held in german or english and takes approximately 45 minutes of your time. The results will be fully anonymized.

If you are interested in participating in an interview, please feel free to send me a message. I truly appreciate any support!

I look forward to interesting conversations!

Best regards,

Lukas Sauter

entry.title: Re: Can We restrict users for reprint of Billing Document...
entry.content: You can configure output determination to allow only one print per output type and prevent reprint unless status is reset manual. This is done via BRF+ rules and output parameter determination - Sir could you please brief me about this. Thanks

entry.title: Re: FIORI APPS PREVIEW NOT LOADING in SAP BTP TRIAL ACCOUNTS
entry.content:
Hello,

 

I think they have removed ES5 SAP System last week. Decommissioning of ES5 was schedule in Oct-2025.

2nd reason might be you need to have the Build WorkZone Service Instance or ABAP Instance subscription into SAP BTP Trial account to run the Fiori applications on BTP Trial account.

Please check once.


Regards,


Swapnil

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Sunny Kapoor and I am a lead product manager for the cloud integration capability of SAP Integration Suite, specializing in enterprise-wide business process integration and digital transformation. With 15 years of professional experience, I offer a comprehensive understanding of both technical implementation and strategic product oversight.

My Session: 

IN162 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture | Tuesday, Nov 4 | 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET

What you will learn about: 

This session introduces attendees to the power of event-driven integration pattern to deliver real-time grounding data, equipping AI system's with the latest business context to make informed and accurate decisions.

AI Grounding is the process of connecting an AI system's abstract knowledge and responses to specific, real-world data and context, reducing "hallucinations" and increasing the reliability and accuracy of its outputs.

 
This session focuses into the advanced realm of real-time vector grounding, where you'll connect structured enterprise data to a large language model using SAP HANA Cloudâ€™s vector database, SAP Integration Suite, and Advanced Event Mesh. Experience firsthand how dynamic data updates can enhance the model's responses in real time, maintaining their contextual precision. By session's end, you'll have constructed an end-to-end, event-driven flow that responds to new sales order events from SAP S/4HANA Cloud and support case events from SAP Service Cloud Version 2, providing an AI assistant with live contextual intelligence. This hands-on scenario simulates an AI-powered Customer Success Digital Assistant, equipping it with real-time sales and support data to deliver accurate insights and informed decision-making capabilities.

Co-speakers:

Prashant Gautam, Senior Product Manager, has been with SAP since 2004. With strong focus on innovation, he works on advancing Artificial Intelligence capabilities in SAP Integration Suite, driving efficiency and modernisation in integration space.

 

Karsten Strothmann is lead product manager and evangelist for event-driven integration at SAP SE in Walldorf, Germany. With over 25 years of experience in the software industry, he has extensively focused on Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) and its implementation at the enterprise level.

 

Piyush Gakhar heads the cross product management & strategy for Integration solutions such as SAP Integration Suite, API Management, Event Mesh & SAP Process Orchestration.

 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

You can also gain some further knowledge around SAP Integration Suite and SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh by attending the following SAP TechEd sessions:

  • IN103 | Helping systems talk smarter with a flexible event-driven architecture
    • Deep Dive
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 2:15 PM - 3:00 PM CET
  • IN165 | Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Thursday, Nov 6 | 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM CET
  • IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET
  • IN163 | Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM CET

Related community topic pages: 

  •  SAP Integration Suite
  • Joule 

Looking forward to seeing you: 

Join to learn how event-driven integration patterns can keep AI systems contextually aware and up-to-date with the latest business information.

Now letâ€™s hear from you:

Weâ€™d love to hear your thoughts on the concept of real-time data grounding using evet-driven architecture. Share your insights and ideas by answering these questions in the comments below:

  • In what ways do you think real-time vector grounding can enhance the capabilities of AI Agents.
  • How do you plan to apply the skills and knowledge gained from this workshop to your ongoing or future projects?

Let's start a conversation and learn from each other's perspectives! 

Don't forget to register for the workshop to secure your spot and join us for this hands-on learning experience!

entry.title: Bridging AI Context and Enterprise Intelligence: The Perplexity MCP Server on SAP BTP
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

Introduction

As enterprises increasingly adopt generative AI and contextual reasoning in their digital landscapes, enabling real-time knowledge access within enterprise agents becomes a key differentiator.
This blog introduces the Perplexity Ask MCP Server, an implementation based on Perplexity.aiâ€™s Model Context Protocol (MCP), adapted to run natively on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

The integration connects SAPâ€™s conversational agents with live web information through the Sonar API, enabling intelligent, contextual responses within enterprise-grade environments â€” while maintaining the governance, security, and extensibility standards of SAP BTP.

Understanding the Perplexity Ask MCP Server

The Perplexity Ask MCP Server is a middleware component that enables AI-driven agents to perform live, contextual queries via the Sonar API.
It follows the Model Context Protocol (MCP), a standardized communication protocol for exchanging contextual messages between AI models, tools, and external systems.

Core Capabilities

  • Real-time conversational access to live web information using the Sonar API.
  • Secure user authentication and authorization with SAP XSUAA.
  • Native deployment and scalability on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry.
  • Stream-based communication aligned with MCP specifications.

Enhancements for SAP BTP Integration

To ensure operational compatibility and compliance within the SAP ecosystem, the MCP server was adapted with several key architectural and deployment enhancements:

 

Enhancement AreaDescription
Runtime Compatibility

Adjusted to build and run natively on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry.

Transport Layer

Implemented streamable HTTP transport to align with the MCP Server.

Server Integration

Optimized for automatic discovery and registration within the MCP Server environment.

Endpoint

Introduced explicit endpoint /rest/mcp/streaming as defined in MCP Server documentation.

Security Integrated SAP XSUAA service for OAuth2-based user authentication and authorization.
 

Available Tools

The Perplexity Ask MCP Server provides a set of smart tools that help enterprise agents find information, answer questions, and perform reasoning tasks in real time. Each tool uses a different Sonar model from Perplexity to support specific types of queries and use cases.

  • perplexity_search
    Searches the live web using the Perplexity Search API and returns organized results with useful details.
    Best for: finding up-to-date information quickly.

  • perplexity_ask
    A conversational AI tool powered by the sonar-pro model. It can answer general questions and combine web search results to give clear, contextual responses.
    Best for: everyday questions and quick conversations.

  • perplexity_research
    Uses the sonar-deep-research model to collect and summarize information from multiple web sources for deeper understanding.
    Best for: research reports, detailed analysis, and exploring complex topics.

  • perplexity_reason
    Built on the sonar-reasoning-pro model, this tool focuses on logic and problem-solving. It helps analyze situations and suggest reasoned conclusions.
    Best for: complex problem-solving, decision-making, and critical reasoning tasks.

The perplexity_ask Tool

The perplexity_ask tool provides a simple yet powerful interface for conversational agents to perform live web searches via the Sonar API.

{
  "messages": [
    {
      "role": "system" | "user" | "assistant",
      "content": "Message text here"
    }
  ]
}

Each message in the array represents a conversational turn, which the MCP server forwards to the Sonar API for processing.
Responses are streamed back to the client through the MCP interface, maintaining context awareness throughout the interaction.

 

Deployment and Configuration on SAP BTP

Step 1. Obtain a Sonar API Key

  1. Sign up for a Sonar API account.
  2. Generate an API key from the developer dashboard.
  3. Optionally, use a shared API key if available within your project landscape.

Step 2. Build and Deploy the MCP Server on Cloud Foundry

Prerequisites

  • SAP BTP subaccount with Cloud Foundry environment enabled.

  • A configured CF space for deployment.

Deployment Steps

  1. Clone and Install Dependencies

git clone <repository-url>
cd perplexity-ask
npm install

2. Build the Project 

npm run build

3. Create XSUAA Service Instance

cf create-service xsuaa application perplexity-mcp-xsuaa -c xs-security.json
cf create-service-key perplexity-mcp-xsuaa <service-key-name>

4. Deploy the Application

cf push

5. Configure the Sonar API Key

cf set-env perplexity-mcp-server PERPLEXITY_API_KEY "<your_api_key>"
cf restage perplexity-mcp-server

Once deployment is complete, verify that the application status is running and healthy (cf apps).

 

Step 3. Create SAP BTP Destination

To enable communication between Agents and the MCP Server, create a destination in the SAP BTP Cockpit.

Retrieve XSUAA Credentials

Use the following command to fetch the required credentials:

cf service-key perplexity-mcp-xsuaa <service-key-name>

 

Configure Destination
| Field                 | Value                                                                           |
| --------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Name**              | PERPLEXITYMCP                                                                   |
| **Type**              | HTTP                                                                            |
| **URL**               | `https://<your-app-route>.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/rest/mcp/streaming` |
| **Proxy Type**        | Internet                                                                        |
| **Authentication**    | OAuth2ClientCredentials                                                         |
| **Client ID**         | `<clientid from XSUAA service key>`                                             |
| **Client Secret**     | `<clientsecret from XSUAA service key>`                                         |
| **Token Service URL** | `<authentication_url>/oauth/token`                                              |

 

 

Step 4. Register the MCP Server in Agents

With the destination in place, register the MCP server as a tool within Agents.

| Field            | Value                                             |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------- |
| **Server Name** | PerplexityMCP                                     |
| **Description**  | MCP server for live web reasoning using Sonar API |
| **Destination**  | PERPLEXITYMCP                                     |

Once deployed, the mcp server should automatically display the available MCP tools â€” including perplexity_ask â€” in the cockpit.
This confirms successful registration and readiness for use with Agents.

 

Interaction Flow

  1. The Agent MCP Server routes the conversation to the MCP Server via the configured destination.
  2. The MCP Server communicates with the Sonar API for live, web-based reasoning.
  3. Responses are streamed back to the Business Agent for contextual display.

 

Security and Compliance Considerations

Security is a core design principle in the integration of the Perplexity Ask MCP Server within SAP BTP. The implementation fully adheres to SAPâ€™s enterprise-grade standards for identity management, data protection, and secure communication.

1. Authentication and Authorization

User authentication and service authorization are managed through SAP XSUAA (X.509-based SAP Authorization and Trust Management Service). The implementation leverages the OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials flow to ensure that only authorized applications and tools within the SAP BTP landscape can access the MCP server. This guarantees secure token-based access and prevents unauthorized invocation of APIs.

2. Secure Communication and Transport

The MCP Server communicates using streamable HTTP, as outlined in the Agent MCP Server specification. This transport mechanism provides a reliable, bidirectional, and low-latency channel for message exchange between the Agent and the MCP Server, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality throughout the interaction.

3. Multi-Tenant Data Isolation

The deployment follows SAP BTPâ€™s multi-tenant security model, which enforces tenant isolation at the application and data layers. Each tenant operates within a securely isolated runtime context, ensuring that no cross-tenant access occurs. This design aligns with SAPâ€™s compliance framework for enterprise applications deployed on BTP.

4. Compliance Alignment

By leveraging SAP-managed services such as XSUAA and adhering to BTPâ€™s runtime security standards, the solution maintains compliance with SAPâ€™s data protection, privacy, and regulatory guidelines. 

Conclusion

The integration of the Perplexity Ask MCP Server with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) demonstrates the platformâ€™s strength in securely hosting and scaling AI-driven workloads while upholding SAPâ€™s governance, trust, and compliance principles.

This architecture lays the foundation for Agentic AI ecosystems on SAP BTP, where intelligent agents can autonomously interact, reason, and take contextual actions within business processes. The result is a more adaptive, insight-driven enterprise that empowers customers and partners to accelerate innovation with secure, scalable, and compliant AI integration.

entry.title: Re: Extracting data from SAP BW/4HANA, is HANA Runtime DB sufficient?
entry.content:
HANA Runtime Database is mainly used to run SAP applications like SAP BW/4HANA, not to do all kinds of data extraction or analysis work.

If your goal is just to keep BW/4HANA working â€” like storing, processing, and managing data that your reports use ,then the HANA Runtime DB is enough. It supports the internal data models and calculations that BW needs to operate smoothly.

But if you want to extract data from BW/4HANA to use in other tools, systems, or analytics platforms, youâ€™ll often need more than just the Runtime license. You might need a HANA Enterprise Edition or HANA Full Use license, depending on how you plan to access and use that data.

The main difference is:

  • Runtime license â€“ only allows use of HANA for SAP applications (like BW/4HANA).

  • Full license â€“ allows you to build your own models, extract data freely, or connect non-SAP tools.

So, if you only need BW reports, Runtime DB is fine.
If you want to pull data out for broader analysis, youâ€™ll need more access than the Runtime license provides.

entry.title: Re: IPS: Global User ID
entry.content:
Hello again, @tskwin,
Not all SAP solutions are ready to store and use the global user ID. You can "infer" this from the target transformation code syntax, e.g., compare SAC and BTP ABAP environment under Target Systems | SAP Help Portal  (search for userUuid). However, this source of information can be misleading, since these default transformations may contain future enhancements (things that are not yet active, as far as I understand).

However, this global user id can be part of the session token if added as attribute in your application definition in CIS. Now, its does not mean it will be used by the app... Another hint: an SAP solution that brags about the magic of Joule ğŸ˜ will certainly need the global user id at some point.
Now, back to your userName question, that is a different one: you must follow the constraints of how the userName can be defined in SAC (and Datasphere), you cannot use all sorts of characters, and only 20, etc. But this userName is not the userUuid (at all). It is up to you to create it so that it is unique, has 20 characters, etc. (see my previous response).
Last "trick" (there are so many, for IPS, since SAP did not do us the favor to add a "debug mode" to it): if you want to understand what you need to put in all fields in a target transformation, I recommend you create a script that uses the SCIM API to collect data from the target - from SAC, in your case. You need to refer to Getting Started | SAP Help Portal, create an OAuth cilent for API Access using Client Credentials, etc. You may find useful info about that here (this is for Datasphere but both are very similar): Comprehensive Overview: SCIM API for SAP Dataspher... - SAP Community
Bonus: below is a PowerShell script to collect SAC Teams, you can change it easily to retrieve users (adjust the url based on your configuration).
Good luck!

# Step 1: Get Access Token
$clientId = "your_client_id_as_created_in_SAC"
$clientSecret = 'your_client_secret_as_created_in_SAC'
$tokenUrl = "https://your_tenant_name.authentication.us20.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token"

# Prepare body as form-url-encoded
$body = @{
    grant_type = "client_credentials"
    client_id = $clientId
    client_secret = $clientSecret
}

# Convert to form-url-encoded content
$tokenResponse = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Post -Uri $tokenUrl `
    -ContentType "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" `
    -Body $body

$accessToken = $tokenResponse.access_token

# Step 2: Retrieve Groups via SCIM
$scimUrl = "https://your_tenant_name.us20.hcs.cloud.sap/api/v1/scim2/Groups"

$userResponse = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri $scimUrl `
    -Headers @{
        Authorization = "Bearer $accessToken"
        "x-sap-sac-custom-auth" = "true"
    }

# Step 3: Output JSON-formatted user data
$userResponse | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 10

entry.title: Re: Wrong material valuation - correction?
entry.content:
Hello @Pavel_Prt 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some recommended references for more details.

Adjust Inventory Balance Sheet Accounts - Delta Posting, MATERIAL LEDGER in S/4HANA

Material price differences between ledgers, In-Depth with SAP S/4HANA â€“ Ledger Scoping Q&A

To summarise, in public cloud, the Material Ledger inconsistency between cost estimate values and the actual valuation data stored under accounting 1 tab you have described can occur if:

  • The defined price unit or costing lot size was not consistently converted during material price update
  • The valuation data wasnâ€™t refreshed across ledgers/currencies after costing release, or
  • Certain ledgers were excluded from price transfer during material valuation update.

Since the re-costing corrected future prices, you only need to fix the historical valuation differences. I suggest you run the Delta Posting app for the ledgers and materials that were affected. It will create adjustments without changing your cost estimates.

You may consider the following option to resolve the issue:

Open the  Delta Posting  app -->

Enter the valuation area/plant and material --> select your Ledger Group (e.g., 0L)

The system will calculate delta values for mismatched ledgers/currencies. Thereafter, post the adjustment entry to correct balance sheet and inventory accounts.

Note, this app adjusts G/L valuation postings only, it does not alter your costing data or cost estimates.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: PO numbering
entry.content: Hey! You donâ€™t necessarily need a separate document type for each company. A common approach is to use **number ranges per company code** for the same PO document type. That way, each company gets its own sequential numbering, but you avoid the hassle of maintaining 20+ document types. If you need more advanced control, you can also use a **BAdI or user-exit** (like `ME_DOCUMENT_BADI`) to tweak numbering or add checks programmatically. Keeps things simpler but still meets the requirement. If you want, I can explain step by step how to set up the number ranges for each company.

entry.title: My Journey in the SAP World: From Curiosity to Passion
entry.content:
Since the beginning of my career, SAP has always been more than just a technology platform â€” it has been a space to learn, grow, and connect business with innovation.

I started working with SAP at a very young age, and what began as curiosity quickly became a true passion. Over the years, Iâ€™ve had the opportunity to explore different areas and witness firsthand how SAP has evolved â€” from traditional ERP systems to todayâ€™s intelligent, data-driven, cloud-based solutions.

Working in SAP has taught me that technology is only one part of the story. The real value comes from understanding business processes, connecting with people, and translating challenges into solutions that make a measurable impact.

What excites me the most today is how  SAPâ€™s intelligent technologies â€” from AI and automation to advanced analytics â€” are transforming Finance and helping organizations make smarter, faster decisions. Itâ€™s inspiring to see how SAP continues to evolve, and how we, as professionals, can evolve with it.

Through this space, Iâ€™d like to share my experiences, insights, and lessons learned throughout my SAP journey â€” hoping to inspire others who, like me, believe in the power of continuous learning and innovation.

Letâ€™s keep growing together in this amazing SAP ecosystem!

#SAPCommunity #SAPCareer ##SAPS4HANA ##WomenInTech  #DigitalTransformation

entry.title: Re: installation issue
entry.content:
Regarding to the message "restricted to corresponding installation", kindly note that is not a error but rather a notification that the corresponding authorization "display service requests" is limited to the installation level *. 

Regarding to Authorization level, please refer to KBA 1898762 - What are the different S-user ID authorization levels that can be assigned? - SAP for Me.

Regarding to your issue, the "display service requests " set on CCC level for * but set on installation level for *. This mean* has the highest level of this authorization, which is why the message is not shown for this S-user. 

If you do not want this message is shown for *, you can update the authorization for CCC level as the *.

Hope my answer could be clarified.

Thanks and best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: How to change the posting date to the current date when creating new bank statement?
entry.content:
How to change the posting date to the current date when creating new bank statement?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to change the posting date to the current date wh...
entry.content:
At the moment, the logic in bank statement is to propose the Statement date and Posting date with the last working date. However, you can always manually change the date when creating new bank statements.

More details can be checked in KBA 1728750 Statement Date and Posting Date of a New Bank Statement Do Not Get Updated.

entry.title: How to reference child object in another custom MDF object
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I noticed an error message when I try to reference child object in another custom MDF object

You have used object cust_ChildObject as the valid value source for field cust_FieldName. The effective dating of object cust_ChildObject is set to â€œFrom Parentâ€. This will lead to errors in accessing quickcards and many other issues. Please remove the field reference.

Therefore, is there another way to reference the child object from the parent object in another custom MDF object? Basically getting the information of the child object of another parent object.

Thank you.

HSN From State To State Tax Rate

entry.title: Regarding changing the email address linked to an S-user account
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

Could you please tell me how to change the email address associated with an S-user?
Is my understanding correct that individual users cannot change their own email addresses?
And that the change must be made from an administrator account?

DIGITS - How to update the email address for S-user IDs - SAP for Me - SAP for Me


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Regarding changing the email address linked to an S-u...
entry.content:
Regarding your concern: Even if you are an administrator, an S-user cannot update their own email address. This update must be performed by an administrator account, as outlined in KBA  3108466 - How to update the email address for S-user IDs - SAP for Me - SAP for Me.

If you need further clarification or assistance in coordinating with an administrator, please do not hesitate to let me know. I am here to ensure you have all the support you need.

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAP SMS Configuration
entry.content:
Great and detailed guide on setting up SMS configuration through SCOT and HTTP in SAP! ğŸ‘

For those working on ABAP development and wanting to trigger SMS directly from a program, you can use the standard SAP program SE38: SWN_TEST_SEND_SMS1.
This program internally uses the CL_BCS class for message sending â€” you can either execute it directly for testing or copy it as a reference for your own custom development.

After execution, you can verify the sent messages in transaction SOST.
This approach is beneficial for validating the configuration before integrating SMS functionality into custom ABAP reports or workflows.

entry.title: Questions regarding SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition functionalities
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
We are considering SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition and have several questions regarding standard functionalities. Any insights would be greatly appreciated.


1. Cost Driver Units
We understand that "time" is available as a cost driver unit. What other units are available as standard options in Public Cloud?
2. Product Costing - List Display
Is it possible to display actual costing and standard costing for multiple materials in a list view?
3. Inventory Valuation
We understand that standard functions include valuation for slow-moving stock and lowest value principle. Is this correct? Is excess stock valuation also available as a standard function?
4. G/L Account Input Control
Is it possible to control G/L account input by user, especially for manufacturing costs and SG&A accounts? Can this be achieved through mechanisms such as cost center-based account assignment restrictions?
5. Fixed Asset Mass Change
Is there a standard function for mass upload/change of fixed asset master data in Public Cloud? If not, is there an API available?
6. Internal Order Alternative in Public Cloud
We understand that Internal Orders are not available in Public Cloud.
Currently, we use two types of settlement mechanisms:

Type A: Using balance sheet accounts (e.g., advances, work in process) with cost collection capability
Type B: Using P&L accounts (e.g., miscellaneous losses, cost variances) without cost collection

Both types allow goods movements from inventory.
Can WBS elements replicate these functionalities? If not, what are the alternative approaches in Public Cloud?
7. Liquidity Management
Could you provide an explanation or documentation of the Liquidity Management (Cash Flow Management) functionality in Public Cloud?
8. Asset Accounting & Investment Management
We manage investment projects including transfers from assets under construction (AuC) to completed assets, tracking balances per investment project.
Without Internal Orders in Public Cloud, how should we handle asset accounting & investment management? Are there any documentation or best practice guides available?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Note: We have 8 specific questions listed above. When responding, please reference the question number (e.g., "Re: Question 1", "Re: Question 3") so we can clearly track which questions have been addressed. We would greatly appreciate responses to all questions if possible.

For questions asking "Is it possible?", please also provide the specific implementation method (e.g., App ID, Fiori app name, configuration path, API name, etc.) if the answer is "Yes".

entry.title: Re: PO numbering
entry.content:
Hi Dinesh, 

You cannot define number ranges by company directly. 

You can use Badi ME_Process_PO_Cust and method Process_header to have your custom logic of numbering by company code. It's very easy.. Just few minutes of coding.

Trust this helps, 

Warm regards,Ramki

entry.title: Re: Automatic accrual creation
entry.content: In Time Off calendar, can you able to view the auto accrual job created for the required time account type? If it is scheduled/created, click and view the information. The job will validate the target population whose anniversary date is matching on the time off calendar run date. If the anniversary date matches then accrual will execute and show the count of target population in the job else it will be showing as "0".

entry.title: Re: RFQ
entry.content:
Hi Dinesh, 

You should be able to change delivery dates in quotation directly as quoted by supplier? Is you do not see it as editable, someone might have made it a display field in screen configuration for the transaction. 

To add warranty fields, you need to use any unused field in quotation or add custom fields in RFQ using BADI which will also appear in quotation. 

Hope this helps

Warm regards, Ramki

entry.title: Changing Functional Area in Cost Center Master After Postings â€” Impact
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are currently reviewing a scenario in our SAP S/4HANA system (module: CO-FM Integration) where a Cost Center that has been active for over a year â€” and has many posted transactions â€” needs to have its Functional Area (FAREA) changed in the master data (KS02).

The cost center is linked to Funds Management (FM) via derivation rules (FMDERIVE) and is also part of Cost-of-Sales P&L reporting by Functional Area.

What system impacts and discrepancies can occur if we change the Functional Area in a Cost Center master that already has historical transactions?

Specifically:

  1. How will this affect historical vs. future postings (in FI / CO)?

  2. Will Funds Management (FM) derive the new Functional Area automatically, and how does it impact budget and commitment tracking?

  3. Will there be any reporting inconsistencies in Cost of Sales P&L or Segment / Functional Reporting?

  4. Are there any SAP Notes or recommended procedures to handle such a change safely (e.g., new cost center creation, reclassification, or FMDERIVE adjustment)?

#CO (Controlling)â€ƒ#FundsManagementâ€ƒ#PublicSectorManagementâ€ƒ#FunctionalAreaâ€ƒ#S4HANAâ€ƒ#BestPractices

entry.title: Report showing the remaining quantity on PO blocked lines
entry.content:
In the Purchasing Document per Project application, the report currently displays a quantity of "0" in the To Be Delivered field for purchase order (PO) lines that are blocked, even if goods receipts (GRs) have previously been posted for those lines. We are seeking a solution to accurately reflect the actual remaining quantity for blocked lines in a format that can be exported to Excel.

 

 

 

Desired Report Output

 

We are seeking a report that includes the following fields:

 

  • PO Number
  • Line Number
  • Document Date
  • Supplier Name and Number
  • Buyer Number
  • Short Text
  • WBS Element
  • Order Quantity
  • Still to be Delivered Quantity
  • Deletion Indicator

 

 

 

Current Solution:

 

We are currently using the â€œPurchasing Documents per Projectâ€ app to extract this data. While the app provides most of the required information, weâ€™ve identified a limitation.

 

For any line items that are deleted or closed (as indicated by the deletion indicator), the report does not retain the quantity received prior to the closure or deletion.

 

Example:

 

If a line originally had a quantity of $10,000 and was closed after receiving $6,000, the report incorrectly reflects that no invoices were applied to that line.

 

Request:

 

We need the report to accurately reflect all payments or receipts made against a line, even if the line has subsequently been closed or deleted.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

Current Solution:

 

We are currently using the â€œPurchasing Documents per Projectâ€ app to extract this data. While the app provides most of the required information, weâ€™ve identified a limitation.

 

For any line items that are deleted or closed (as indicated by the deletion indicator), the report does not retain the quantity received prior to the closure or deletion.

 

 

 

 




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Report showing the remaining quantity on PO blocked l...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Thank you for your detailed request.

We understand that you would like the report to accurately reflect all goods receipts and invoice payments made against a purchase order line, even if the line item has subsequently been closed or deleted.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the behavior you observe is as designed. Once a PO line is marked as closed or deleted, the standard â€œPurchasing Documents per Projectâ€ app dynamically updates the â€œTo Be Deliveredâ€ field to zero, since no further deliveries are expected. As a result, previously received or invoiced quantities are not retained in this field.

Once a line item is marked for deletion or closed, the system assumes no further deliveries are expected and therefore does not retain the historical quantity in the â€œTo Be Deliveredâ€ field

you may explore the CDS views : https://api.sap.com/

If you prefer a standard app, you can review the â€œMonitor Purchase Order Itemsâ€ (App ID: F0843A), which provides detailed GR/IR information, though it may not include all project-related fields.

 

Thanks

SAP SUPPORT

entry.title: SAP Cloud Integration â€“ A Deep Dive into the IBM MQ (JMS Subscribe) Adapter
entry.content:
As businesses increasingly operate across both cloud and on-premise systems, they need a reliable way for these environments to communicate seamlessly in real time. The SAP Integration Suite enables this by providing a rich set of adapters that ensure secure, scalable, and effortless connectivity between systems. In this blog, I will discuss one of the recently released IBM MQ Adapter.

IBM MQ Adapter in SAP CI

IBM MQ is a secure and reliable messaging solution that enables applications, systems, services, and files to communicate by exchanging messages through queues. It simplifies and accelerates the integration of applications and the sharing of business data across diverse platforms.

The IBM MQ Adapter is available in both sender and receiver modes to streamline message-based workflows and comes in two variants â€” REST and JMS (Java Message Service).

Key Features

The IBM MQ Adapter (JMS variant) provides the following key features:

  • Sender adapter facilitates automatic message delivery via JMS Subscribe variant and Supports Persistent and Non-persistent message delivery via JMS.
  • Supports Transactional JMS Session for data consistency and Byte and Text JMS messages.
  • Provides multiple actions for failed transaction handling: Keep the Message and Process Again or Move to Another Queue.
  • Receiver adapter allows reliable publishing of messages to Topics and Queues.
  • Supports multiple authentications: Basic, Client Certificate, and None.

Practical Use Case Walkthrough:

Here we will demonstrate how to write employee data (sending it as a message) to a queue on the IBM MQ server using IBM MQ Receiver adapter and read the message from the queue with help of the IBM MQ Sender Adapter.

IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter: Write Employee Data to a Queue

Architecture for IBM MQ Receiver adapter

When the IBM MQ Adapter is used as a receiver adapter, SAP Integration Suite acts as the initiator of the calls.

SAP Integration Suite tenant sends the operation request to IBM MQ (this is a receiver system), IBM MQ Receiver Adapter works on the request and sends the data back using JMS protocol to the SAP Integration Suite tenant.

Prepare Details

In the Content Modifier, you can define employee details, such as names, organization, role, and salary.

EmployeeId: EMP1005
EmployeeName: Shubham
Organization: XX Industries
Role: Senior Analyst
Salary: 75000
Join Date: 2025-10-07

Configure the Connection tab for IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter

The Connection tab includes connection and authentication settings for IBM MQ Adapter.

For more information regarding the authentication, refer to the IBM MQ for SAP Integration Suite.

Connection Tab:

Parameter

Description

Hostname

Specify the hostname to connect to IBM MQ.

Port

Specify the port number to connect to IBM MQ.

Example as 31656

Authentication

Select the type of authentication for connecting to IBM MQ:

  • Basic: Provides authentication using User Credentials.
  • Client Certificate: The server authenticates the client by receiving the client's certificate during the SSL handshake and verifying that the certificate is valid.
  • None: Direct connection can be made without User Credentials.

Credential Name

Specify the User Credential artifact that stores the username-password pair.

Example as IBM_MQ_54

Proxy type

Select the proxy type as Internet

SSL Cipher Suite

The specific set of cryptographic algorithms used to establish a secure, encrypted connection (SSL/TLS) between the adapter and the IBM MQ queue manager.

Example as *TLS12HIGHER

Queue Manager Name

Specify the name of the queue manager to connect for messaging.

Example as MQD

Channel Name

Specify the Channel Name in IBM MQ.

Example as CLOUD.APP.SVRCONN

Application Name

Specify the Application Name for the connection.

Example as MainApplication

Transport/Network Protocol

Select the type of protocol as TCP/IP.

Character Set ID (CCSID) for Non-ASCII Names

Specify the Character Set ID (CCSID) for Non-ASCII Names for the JMS connection.

Example: 819

Execute Write Message Using the IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter

Go to the Processing tab, select the Message Destination Type as Queue, and specify the Queue Name where the message will be sent on the IBM MQ server.

Select the Target Client as JMS-Compliant and enable the Transactional JMS Session to ensure data consistency.

Processing Tab:

Parameter

Description

Message Destination Type

Select the Message Destination Type as Queue

Queue Name

(only available when Message Destination Type is set to Queue)

Specify the name of the queue to write.

Example as DemoQueue1

Target Client

Select the target client type as JMS-Compliant: JMS message properties and headers will be accessible.

Transactional JMS Session

Enable the checkbox to ensure data consistency.

Advanced Message Properties

Parameter

Description

Message Type

Select the Message Type as Text.

Correlation ID

Specify the correlation ID, which is a 48-character hexadecimal encoded string, representing 24 bytes as 414d5120514d4144455620202020202067d8bf5923582e02

Note

You can also specify an application-specific value, like My Custom CorelID. This sets the correlation ID of the created message.

Delivery Mode

Select the message delivery mode as Persistent.

ReplyTo Destination

Specify the destination as QMGR2.

Expiry

Specify the message expiration time as 60000 milliseconds

Priority

Specify the priority for the message. The value can range from 0-9.

Time Stamp

Specify the message timestamp as 60000 in milliseconds.

Once the adapter is deployed successfully, we can verify it in the monitoring tab. In response, we will receive the message details in the header.

In the IBM MQ Application, here we can see that employee details have been written in the mentioned Queue (DemoQueue1).

Reading Employee Data from a Queue Using the IBM MQ (JMS Subscribe) Sender Adapter

Once the data is written on the queue, now we will see how we can use the IBM MQ JMS Sender Adapter to read a message from the same queue.

Sender Adapter (JMS Subscribe)

The IBM MQ Sender adapter is designed to function as a sender adapter. In such a scenario where the adapter is used as a sender adapter, IBM MQ (Subscribe) acts as the initiator of the calls.

The adapter subscribes to a specific queue/topic, receiving messages as they are published. A subscription enables automatic receipt of messages when you subscribe to a specific message destination type.

Configure the Connection tab for IBM MQ (JMS Subscribe) Sender Adapter

**All the Connection tab details for IBM MQ Sender are the same as JMS Receiver explained above**

Read a Message using the IBM MQ JMS (Subscribe) Sender Adapter

In the IBM MQ JMS Sender Adapter, you can read a message by selecting the Message Destination Type as Queue and specifying the Queue Name from where the message will be read on the IBM MQ server.

You can also enable Transactional JMS Session for data consistency and select Failed Transactions Handling according to your scenario. Specify the Max Delivery Count and Queue Name if failed transaction handling is selected as Move Message To Another Queue.

Once the adapter is deployed successfully, we can verify it in the monitoring tab. In response, we will receive the message body.

The IBM MQ JMS adapter is a helpful tool in the SAP Integration Suite. It makes it easier to connect IBM MQ systems running in your own data centre with cloud-based systems.

It enables reliable, event-driven messaging and supports robust integration scenarios across hybrid landscapes across both cloud and on-premise setups. As companies grow and update their IT systems, this adapter helps keep everything connected and secure.

Quick Links

For information about IBM MQ adapter configuration, see SAP Help | IBM MQ Adapter. 

For detailed information about the IBM MQ adapter, see IBM MQ Adapter Guide.

Note: The IBM MQ adapter is available as part of your SAP Integration Suite license.

Labels

  • Technology Updatesâ€‹
  • IBMMQ JMS

entry.title: Re: Retrieve the task list operations for a specific mate...
entry.content:
For information, below are the key concepts behind CA03 behaviour

CA03 shows operations from task list type â€œSâ€ (standard routing), but it can also show â€œRâ€ (reference operation sets) if the routing references another set via VPLNR and VPLAL.

Even if VPLNR and VPLAL are empty, CA03 might still resolve operations from referenced sets via indirect links or defaulting logic. You may need to join PLKO/PLPO again using VPLNR and VPLAL when they exist.

CA03 filters operations based on the valid-from date (DATUV). If your query doesnâ€™t filter by a specific date, you might be pulling inactive or outdated operations.

CA03 resolves the correct sequence (PLAS.ZAEHL) based on validity and usage. You might need to filter for the most recent or active sequence.

You can explore the below enhancements

Handle reference operation sets by adding a LEFT JOIN to PLPO again using VPLNR and VPLAL to resolve referenced operations. Then use COALESCE to pull operation data from either the main or reference set. Ensure you're only pulling from task list type â€œSâ€

PLFL helps resolve alternative sequences. If you want to be precise, include it to get the correct ZAEHL for the sequence

entry.title: Install custom functions in COHV (2/3)
entry.content:
Introduction

The previous episode demonstrated how to create and register a custom mass processing function code in COHV. Now it is time to implement the function.

SAP standard mass processing functions are implemented with COWORK<code> function groups, e.g. the function group COWORK230 implements the mass processing function 230 Close.

I am going to copy the function group COWORK170 to a custom function group and implement the custom mass processing logic there. Before that, let us execute a couple of preliminary steps.

I am trying to keep to SAP naming convention throughout all the subsequent steps.

 

Dialog structure creation

Copy the COWORK170_SETUP structure to ZCOWORK999_SETUP with SE11.

 

Function group ZCOWB999 creation

 

Function group ZCOWB999 adjustments

Now we need to scan the ZCOWB999 function group and replace all the artifacts of the standard COWB170 function group with our custom objects:

Find objectâ€¦Replace with objectâ€¦
CO_WORK170_CREATEZ_CO_WORK999_CREATE
CO_WORK170_DELETE<Z_CO_WORK999_DELETE
CO_WORK170_EXEC_SINGLEZ_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE
CO_WORK170_INITIALIZE_EXECZ_CO_WORK999_INITIALIZE_EXEC
CO_WORK170_SAVEZ_CO_WORK999_SAVE
CO_WORK170_SETUP_PAIZ_CO_WORK999_SETUP_PAI
CO_WORK170_SETUP_PBOZ_CO_WORK999_SETUP_PBO
CO_WORK170_UPDATE_INTERNZ_CO_WORK999_UPDATE_INTERN
COWORK170_SETUPZCOWORK999_SETUP
COWB170PARZCOWB999PAR

The easiest way to do that is to search for the source code of the ZCOWB999 function group for WORK170 string.

Here are my changes:

 

Custom processing logic

As we have copied the function group ZCOWB999 from SAP standard COWB170, for now it works exactly the same way as SAP original and executes the same mass processing logic. The mass processing logic starts at line 129 and ends at line 219 of the Z_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE function.

Let us replace that with same trivial test custom logic:

As you see my custom logic is just to log a message without any actual updates to an order. The goal here is to make sure that each order selected in COHV is processed by the function, that its number is correctly recognized and that the function correctly logs processing messages.

 

Testing

I am running COHV and choosing my 999 custom mass processing function:

Next, I am selecting a couple of production orders and execute the mass processing function:

Finally, I am displaying the processing log:

As you can see each of the selected orders have been processed by the Z_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE function, which logged the message.

 

Wrap up

The article presents a straightforward method to implement custom mass processing functions in the COHV transaction. Naturally, real life scenarios require actual production order updates, not just logging messages. The updates can be posted by production order BAPIs for instance.

We will look under the hood of mass processing in the next episode and explore more advanced topics like how the functions work together, processing parameterization or test mode. Stay tunedâ€¦

entry.title: Re: Inspection for delivery saved with warnings; see logM...
entry.content:
Go to SU3 or SU01, and look for parameters like WERKS, QALS, QMAT, QINSP (quality-related). Compare with a working user, even one missing or misconfigured parameter can cause unexpected behavior.

In MSR_INSPWH, users can save personal variants or layouts. Ask the affected user to reset their layout (via Settings â†’ Layout â†’ Manage). Try running the transaction with no variant selected.

Go to SLG1, input Object as MSR_INSP, Subobject as INSPECTION. Enter the affected user ID and date range. This will show the exact warning message and context â€” often pointing to missing data or failed logic.
